page.title: 07TRADE SHOPS & SERVICES
page.content: The shops in Dornoch are mainly in the town centre, apart from a small shop in Camore. There is plenty parking space close to shops. Opening hours are from half past eight to half past five. There is a supermarket, grocer, home-bakery and butchers. In recent years three other grocery shops have closed but were replaced with a menswear shop ice cream parlour and kitchen centre. Many people prefer to shop in Inverness, or Golspie where goods are often cheaper. Older people, and those without cars, rely on the shops and services in Dornoch. There are shops such as Town Jail which have a good selection of Scottish craft and tourist souvenirs. Many people from neighbouing villages come to Dornoch for shopping and special services such as banking, hairdressing, soliciting and building societies.
